name: Côte d'Ivoire
description: Côte d'Ivoire, formerly the Ivory Coast, is a West African nation known for its cocoa production, vibrant culture, and stunning natural landscapes. Situated along the Atlantic coast, it boasts diverse ecosystems ranging from rainforests and savannas to coastal wetlands. The country is a significant economic hub in West Africa and plays a crucial role in regional trade and stability.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The official capital city of Côte d'Ivoire.
quickFacts.detail: Yamoussoukro is a planned city and a symbol of the country's post-colonial ambition.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Côte d'Ivoire has a large and growing population.
quickFacts.detail: The population is predominantly young and urbanized.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Côte d'Ivoire is a relatively large country in West Africa.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Liberia, Burkina Faso, Ghana, and Nigeria.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language of Côte d'Ivoire.
quickFacts.detail: Créole is widely spoken as a lingua franca.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency used in Côte d'Ivoire.
quickFacts.detail: It is pegged to the Euro.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Côte d'Ivoire has a growing economy.
quickFacts.detail: Cocoa and petroleum are key contributors to the GDP.

climateData.title: Climate of Côte d'Ivoire
climateData.description: Côte d'Ivoire experiences a tropical climate with distinct wet and dry seasons. The country is largely influenced by the Intertropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ), leading to heavy rainfall during the summer months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is characterized by low rainfall and high temperatures. It's a popular time for tourism and agricultural activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy rainfall and high humidity. Flooding can occur in some areas.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan Winds
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The Harmattan is a dry and dusty trade wind that blows from the Sahara Desert, bringing cooler temperatures and reduced rainfall.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Nimba
naturalWonders.description: Mount Nimba is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the highest point in Côte d'Ivoire. It's a unique geological formation with significant biodiversity and is a key site for studying ancient human settlements.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is composed of granodiorite and contains significant deposits of minerals, including gold and diamonds. Its steep slopes and rugged terrain provide a challenging but rewarding hiking experience.

naturalWonders.name: Lagoons of Téta
naturalWonders.description: The Lagoons of Téta are a complex of interconnected lagoons and swamps located in the western part of Côte d'Ivoire. They are a vital habitat for a wide range of bird species and other wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lagoons are fed by seasonal rivers and are subject to fluctuating water levels. They provide important breeding grounds for migratory birds and are a crucial part of the country's wetland ecosystem.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Côte d'Ivoire
ecosystemData.overview: Côte d'Ivoire possesses a remarkable diversity of ecosystems, including rainforests, savannas, coastal wetlands, and shea butter forests. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Côte d'Ivoire’s forests are primarily tropical rainforests, playing a vital role in carbon sequestration and biodiversity conservation.

statistics.details: A high level of endemism is found within the forest flora.
Significant deforestation is occurring due to logging and agriculture.

notableSpecies.name: Gorilla
notableSpecies.significance: A critically important primate species for the region.

notableSpecies.name: Indri
notableSpecies.significance: The largest lemur species, known for its distinctive calls.

biodiversityCategories.name: Savannas
biodiversityCategories.description: Côte d'Ivoire’s savannas are characterized by grasslands and scattered trees, supporting a variety of grazing animals and predators.

statistics.details: Supports a diverse range of grazing herbivores.
Includes elephants, antelopes, and various predators.

notableSpecies.name: African Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the savanna ecosystem.

activities.title: Activities in Côte d'Ivoire
activities.description: Côte d'Ivoire offers a range of outdoor activities, from exploring its stunning natural landscapes to experiencing its vibrant culture.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the mountainous regions and rainforests of Côte d'Ivoire on foot.

activities.name: Mount Nimba Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Mount Nimba, offering stunning views and a chance to experience the unique geology of the region.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, sunscreen, local guide

activities.name: Forest Trail Hike
activities.description: A gentle hike through the rainforest, offering a chance to observe the diverse flora and fauna.
safety: Be aware of snakes and insects

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities along the Ivorian coast and in its rivers and lakes.

activities.name: Coastal Fishing
activities.description: Experience traditional Ivorian fishing techniques and catch your own seafood.

activities.name: River Cruise
activities.description: Explore the rivers of Côte d'Ivoire by boat, observing wildlife and enjoying the scenery.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, jacket, sweater, long pants

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, map, compass
